item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Creates Charming Junimo Nightlight
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley fans showcase their love for the game through creative crafts like stained-glass nightlights of Junimo creatures.
  • Developer Eric Barone engages with fans through festivals and merchandise like the recent cookbook, expanding the game's appeal outside gameplay.
  • Continuously updated, Stardew Valley remains a beloved life-sim game with a dedicated fan base enjoying both in-game and real-life content.

Fans of Stardew Valley are known to bring their love of the farming game to life in a number of ways, with one player making an adorable stained-glass nightlight in honor of the Junimo creatures. Stardew Valley fan crafts have proven to be incredibly popular among community members, with a number of unique creations popping up in online spaces and even in real life.

First released in 2016, Stardew Valley is a life-sim game that features farming, fishing, foraging, mining, and crafting gameplay. The game sees players taking on the role of a farmer on a homestead outside the quaint Pelican Town, where they must forge a life of their own. Fans of the indie title have praised its relaxing gameplay and wholesome storytelling, with the more mysterious and magical elements of the game earning particular adoration from the Stardew fandom.

Related
Stardew Valley Fan Creates Adorable Junimo Cross-Stitch

A Stardew Valley fan picks up cross-stitching as a new hobby and decides to make an adorable Junimo as one of their first creations.

Stardew Valley fan jennybead shared a look at their incredibly cute Junimo stained-glass nightlight. The Junimos in Stardew Valley are a type of forest spirit, and the apple-shaped creatures assist the player in repairing the Pelican Town Community Center. Players can also build a Junimo Hut on their farm and receive agricultural help from the Junimos. Jennybead utilized a circular metal frame and small rod segments to create the outline of the Junimo and brought the quaint creature to life with two pieces of glass - one for the main body and one for the small leaf atop its head. Once finished, the green Junimo stained-glass portion was mounted upon a pre-fabricated white nightlight plug. Fellow fans praised the adorable creation, noting how it perfectly captures the magical essence of the Junimo.

Stardew Valley Content Outside The Game

While Stardew Valley remains one of the most beloved and successful indie games of all time, fans have been highly appreciative of the variety of content available to enjoy outside the game itself. Developer Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone has been traveling the world to attend the various showings of the Stardew Valley Festival of Seasons concert tour , and several lines of official merchandise, including a recently released cookbook, have allowed fans to experience some of their favorite game elements in the real world. Community members have even encountered Stardew Valley items at local cafes and special displays at non-gaming retailers, showcasing the expansive popularity of the farming sim.

Considered by many to be among the best life-sim video games, Stardew Valley continues to delight fans with new game updates, official products, and fan-made crafts. With the recent PC release of Update 1.6 and continuous creativity among players, Stardew Valley fans have plenty of unique content to enjoy both in-game and in daily life.

item.title: Steam Removes Helldivers 2 Purchase Restrictions From Several Countries
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 relisted on Steam in select countries after Sony's controversial PSN account linking requirement caused backlash.
  • Initial success of Helldivers 2 on PC led to significant revenue, highlighting the importance of multi-platform releases in the gaming industry.
  • Steam issued refunds to players affected by PSN requirement, showing the impact of player dissatisfaction on game availability.

Helldivers 2 has been relisted on Steam in a few countries after previously being delisted due to Sony’s controversial decision to require PlayStation Network (PSN) account linking for PC players. Helldivers 2 , the cooperative shooter developed by Arrowhead Game Studios, faced significant backlash when Sony mandated that all PC players link a PSN account to their Steam accounts to continue playing the game.

The delisting of Helldivers 2 affected over 180 countries, significantly limiting access for a large portion of the gaming community. This move followed a surge of negative feedback from players, which eventually led Sony to reverse the PSN account linking requirement. Despite reversing the decision, Helldivers 2 remains unavailable in many regions , causing frustration among fans who were eager to play one of the year’s most popular releases.

Related
Helldivers 2 Player Reveals Helpful Strategy That Makes Killing Bile Titans Easier

A Helldivers 2 player shares game-changing strategy to beat the Bile Titan using two of the most powerful strategems in the game.

Steam Relists Helldivers 2 in Several Countries

According to a recent SteamDB update , Helldivers 2 is now available for purchase again in American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. These territories, all associated with the United States, were the first to see the restrictions lifted. This partial relisting suggests that Sony might be beginning to address the widespread unavailability of the game. The move is seen as a small but hopeful step toward making Helldivers 2 accessible to players worldwide again.

Helldivers 2 's initial success was due in large part to its simultaneous release on both PlayStation 5 and PC in February 2024. This strategy diverged from Sony’s usual practice of delaying PC ports and aimed to capitalize on the growing PC gaming market. Despite early server issues, the game quickly gained a large following, selling over 12 million copies and becoming one of Sony’s fastest-selling games. However, the enforced PSN account linking on Helldivers 2 led to a steep decline in its Steam rating and numerous refund requests.

In an effort to manage player dissatisfaction, Steam made the rare move of issuing refunds to Helldivers 2 players even if they had exceeded the standard two-hour playtime limit. This decision came in response to the significant backlash and demonstrated the scale of the issue. Many players were relieved by the reversal of the PSN requirement, although they remained frustrated by the continued unavailability of the game in numerous regions.

Industry analyst Mat Piscatella highlighted that the PC version of Helldivers 2 accounted for over half of the game’s U.S. sales, making it Sony’s seventh highest-grossing game in the U.S. This achievement underscores the importance of multi-platform releases and the potential revenue from the PC gaming market. The success of Helldivers 2 on PC played a crucial role in its overall performance, highlighting the changing landscape of game distribution. The relisting of Helldivers 2 in a few countries is a positive sign, but the broader issue of global accessibility remains. As the gaming industry evolves, ensuring equitable access to games across different regions and platforms is increasingly important.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Designs Falinks as a Fighting/Ghost-Type
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fan creates stunning alternative form for Falinks, giving it a tragic backstory and unique design.
  • The artist imagines Falinks as a Fighting/Ghost-type with the leader marching on in memory of fallen comrades.
  • Pokemon community praises d3ad8un's creative work, comparing the concept to Basculin's evolution but even more brilliant.

A talented Pokemon fan has created a new form for Falinks, giving the critter an inventive design. With the release of Pokemon Sword and Shield , Pokemon fans were introduced to new features such as the Dynamax and Gigantamax transformations, the debut of the Rotom Phone to replace the Rotom Pokedex, and dozens of new Pokemon.

Pokemon Sword and Shield added 96 new Pokemon to the National Pokedex registry, among them names popular with fans such as Sirfetch'd, Applin, and Greedent. Another Pokemon featured in Gen 8 is Falinks, a small but brave Fighting-type. Falinks is a group of bipedal Pokemon that wear yellow armor and march in a line, giving the formation the shape of a centipede. In combat, Falinks adopts different strategies and formations, always following their leader's orders as absolute. While Falinks is an interesting Gen 8 Pokemon, one Pokemon artist has taken inspiration from Pokemon to create an alternative form that has attracted the attention of the community.

Related
Dad Bakes Sweet Pokemon Togepi Pie For His Daughter

A stepdad bakes a yummy-looking Togepi pie for his stepdaughter, charming fellow Pokemon fans and gaining praise for the show of parental love.

Twitter user d3ad8un created an alternative form for Falinks that imagines the Pokemon as a Fighting/Ghost-type. The fan art depicts only the leader of the troop, known as "the brass," wearing the group's characteristic armor. The top of the leader's helmet, which is slightly larger than the other soldiers, has an even higher tip, with a white flag on top of it. The brass has a fierce look and a scar over one of its eyes, and the soldiers who used to follow it now appear as ghosts, giving an impressive makeover to one of the best Gen 8 Pokemon .

Incredible Pokemon Fan Art Imagines Falinks as a Lone Soldier

As well as making impressive fan art, the artist has created a Pokedex entry that gives the Falinks leader a tragic and heroic backstory. According to the artist's text, the brass has lost its Falinks comrades, so it puts on a brave face and marches in their memory, having the power of an entire army. While Falinks has no evolution , it works similarly to Pokemon such as Exeggcute and Maushold, which are formations of individuals.

The Pokemon community is remarkably creative at giving new forms to their favorite Pokemon, and Falinks is no different. Pokemon fans have praised d3ad8un's work, with one user saying that the artist's concept reminded them of the creepy way Basculin evolves , "but way more brilliant." With Pokemon Legends: Z-A coming out only next year, fans will have time to imagine more evolutions for Pokemon, while waiting to find out if Falinks will finally receive a new form.

item.title: Rumor: Classic Rockstar Game Could Be Coming to Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus Premium
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gamers on Xbox Game Pass and PlayStation Plus may soon be able to enjoy the original Red Dead Redemption, according to recent rumors.
  • Rockstar has a history with both Microsoft and Sony's subscription services, with titles like RDR2 appearing on both platforms in the past.
  • The addition of Red Dead Redemption to PS Plus Premium and Game Pass would make the classic game more accessible to a wider audience.

Xbox Game Pass and PlayStation Plus Premium subscribers might have another big addition to look forward to in the near future, as recent rumors indicate that the original Red Dead Redemption could be headed to the two subscription services. It's not often that Microsoft and Sony end up adding the same exact game to the libraries of their respective services at around the same time, so the inclusion of a beloved Rockstar game like Red Dead Redemption would be a welcome surprise for players on both platforms.

Though the release of their games on Game Pass and PlayStation Plus is somewhat infrequent compared to other developers, Rockstar does, nonetheless, have a history with Microsoft and Sony's flagship subscription services. Just recently, for instance, Red Dead Redemption 2 was added as part of May 2024's PlayStation Plus lineup after being removed from the service two years ago. Xbox Game Pass subscribers had access to RDR2 as well for a brief period of time in 2020, in addition to other Rockstar titles like Grand Theft Auto 5 and Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas - The Definitive Edition . And now, according to some recently unveiled information, it seems like the original Red Dead Redemptio n could be the next game from Rockstar to make its debut on both PS Plus and Game Pass.

Related
Red Dead Redemption 2 Earns Incredible Sales Achievement

Red Dead Redemption 2 climbs the ranks to make a major sales achievement, surpassing some incredible gaming classics in the process.

As spotted by Reddit user Timtendo12, who posted his findings on the r/GamingLeaksAndRumors subreddit, a line of code has been discovered within the official Rockstar website that hints at the original Red Dead Redemption being added to PS Plus Premium and Xbox Game Pass in the future. An unused description that was recently added to RDR1 's about page states that Rockstar's beloved 2010 action-adventure game "is available for Nintendo Switch, PS3, PlayStation Plus Premium for PS4 and PS5, Xbox 360, and Xbox Game Pass for Xbox One and Xbox Series X|S."

Red Dead Redemption has been released on nearly all the platforms listed in the description, except for Microsoft and Sony's subscription services. Therefore, unless this line of code was written accidentally by some Rockstar employee, then there's a good chance that RDR1 will launch onto both PS Plus Premium and Game Pass sooner rather than later. It's also important to note that such an announcement would coincide with the release of the original Red Dead Redemption on GTA+ earlier this year, so it wouldn't be farfetched for Rockstar to bring the game to more subscription services.

With a Game Pass and PS Plus Release, Red Dead Redemption Could Be Available to More Players Than Ever Before

For years, Rockstar's seminal 2010 open world cowboy game was only available on PS3, Xbox 360, and modern Xbox consoles via backwards compatibility, severely limiting the number of people that could access it on current hardware. Fortunately, though, Rockstar eventually ported Red Dead Redemption and its standalone expansion Undead Nightmare to PS4 and Nintendo Switch in late 2023. And with rumors of a Red Dead Redemption PC port incoming, alongside a potential Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus Premium drop, it seems like this classic Rockstar Games title may soon be available to more players than ever before.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Reveals an Iconic Sniper is Returning in Season 4
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kar98 sniper rifle hinted at return in Call of Duty: Warzone season 4, fans eagerly anticipating its comeback.
  • Call of Duty team dropping teasers like toy car with "98" to confirm Kar98 rifle's return.
  • Fans reminiscing about Kar98's impact in early Warzone days, hoping for Modern Warfare version in S4.

The Kar98 sniper rifle is all but confirmed to be returning to the battlefield in Call of Duty: Warzone . The Call of Duty team has dropped several hints and teases regarding the devastating rifle's arrival back into the game, and fans can't wait for it to return to Call of Duty: Warzone .

The Call of Duty team likes to drop hints and teases for new updates, and fans have gotten used to scrutinizing every detail. A teaser for Warzone Season 4 has been released consisting of a number of quick cuts between various images, assets, and themes that are presumably coming to the game with the new season. One of these images is the receiver of a very specific sniper rifle that fans immediately clocked.

Related
Call of Duty Warzone 2 Season 4: All Points of Interest in the New Vondel Map

Details of Call of Duty Warzone's anticipated Season 4 are finally here, revealing a brand-new Warzone map fit with a range of intriguing POIs.

The rifle has been identified, making it all but certain that the Kar98 will return to Call of Duty: Warzone in Season 4. In addition to the teaser, the Call of Duty Twitter account replied to a post from late March, where a fan asked if the Kar would return, given that a map from Warzone 's early days had also returned. The reply simply said "K." The team also sent packages to Call of Duty content creators and streamers consisting of a toy car with the number 98 on it. The packaging also contained a scratch-off section that revealed the letter "K."

The Kar98 was incredibly popular in the early days of Call of Duty: Warzone , and fans would spend hours figuring out the best Kar98 loadout . A well-designed loadout would provide steady and snappy aim resulting in devastating one-shot kills for those who could master it. It appeared in several games throughout the Call of Duty series, most recently appearing in then Call of Duty: Vanguard, but it was the Modern Warfare version that made it into Warzone . After its removal from Warzone it was missed so much that fans began to attempt to recreate the rifle using different guns and parts available in-game.

Warzone Players Concerned Over Which Kar Will Star

While fans are excited about the Kar's return, anxiety persists over whether the rifle will function like it did in Modern Warfare as opposed to the Vanguard version. Fans have noticed strengths and weaknesses in each version, including the no-glint Kar98 glitch that was present in the original Warzone , but seem to be pulling for the Modern Warfare (2019) version. In a game where precise weapon tuning and loadouts can mean the difference between victory and defeat, competitive players looking to climb next season's leaderboards will be keeping a sharp eye on what version of the Kar98 returns to Call of Duty: Warzone . Season 4 begins on May 29.
